Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Vase
Description: Small oval-shaped vase with an almost spherical body, neckless but with a narrow mouth with a flared lip. The clay is fine, compact, well fired and red-orange. The vessel has been polished, though the imprint of a string used by the potter on the equatorial diametre is still visible.
